business.headline: RBI simplifies process for claim settlement of deceased account holdersThe new framework by the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has been introduced to remove the confusion caused by different practices followed by banks earlier.

When will the 8th Pay Commission be implemented? Here's what you should knowThe Pay Commission affects much more than basic salaries. It influences allowances, pensions, and long-term financial security. In times of rising inflation, employees and pensioners are especially keen for the Commission's work to begin.

From CEOs to ministers, support pours in for Zoho's ArattaiThe rise of Arattai has caught the attention of users, industry leaders, and public figures, many of whom have shared their support and congratulations for Zoho and its founder, Sridhar Vembu.

Who should invest in Tata Capital IPO? Market expert weighs inThe Tata Capital IPO is around the corner, and many investors are wondering whether it's the right bet. A market expert has broken down who should consider subscribing and who may want to stay cautious.

Sensex, Nifty close flat as investors turn cautious over US-India trade dealThe S&P BSE Sensex closed 61.52 points lower to end at 80,364.94, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 19.80 points to close at 24,634.90.

Moody's keeps India's Baa3 rating unchanged with stable outlookMoody's said India's strengths include its large and fast-growing economy, a sound external position, and a stable domestic financing base for fiscal deficits.

Beyond metros: How festive cheer boosts real estate demand in Tier-2 citiesWhile metros grab most of the headlines, smaller cities are quietly stealing the show. With festivals around the corner, Tier-2 cities are witnessing a strong spike in property interest and sales.

Lufthansa layoffs: German airline plans 4,000 job cuts over next 5 yearsThe job cuts will mainly affect administrative roles rather than operational positions such as pilots, cabin crew or ground staff.

Does EPFO's new ECR system simplify return filing for employers?The Employees' Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO) has launched a revamped electronic challan-cum-return (ECR) system, aiming to make return filing easier and more accurate for employers. But does it really simplify the process?

Will RBI announce a rate cut in the upcoming MPC meeting? Here's what to expectThe Reserve Bank of India's Monetary Policy Committee begins its three-day meeting to decide whether it is time to cut interest rates or hold steady. With inflation easing and growth signals mixed, all eyes are on what the central bank does next.
Experts reveal best festive stocks to buy amid global uncertaintyConcerns over global trade talks with the US and new protectionist measures have weighed on investor sentiment
Sensex opens 142 points higher, Nifty above 24,500; BEL gains 2%The S&P BSE Sensex added 114.15 points to 80,540.61, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 36.45 points to 24,691.15 as of 9:24 am.

entertainment.headline: Nicole Kidman and Keith Urban separate after nearly 20 years of marriage Nicole Kidman and Keith Urban have separated following almost two decades together. The couple share two children and have been married since 2006.

Jay Kelly trailer: George Clooney plays fading movie icon, Adam Sandler his manager Actor George Clooney returns in 'Jay Kelly', a dramedy about fame and family struggles. The film explores personal reckonings and complex relationships against a Hollywood backdrop.

Allu Arjun wishes cutie wife Sneha Reddy with vacation pics Actor Allu Arjun celebrated wife Sneha Reddy's birthday with a heartfelt social media wish. The actor shared scenic pictures from their vacation.

Saad Bilgrami says several Dhadak 2 scenes left him emotional, crying after shoot Actor Saad Bilgrami shared in an exclusive conversation that it was very difficult for him to shoot certain emotionally charged scenes in the film. He plays Ronnie in the romantic film.

Veteran theatre artist and filmmaker Yashwant Sardeshpande dies of heart attack Yashwant Sardeshpande, a celebrated Kannada theatre artist and filmmaker, died of a heart attack in Bengaluru. His death marks a significant loss to Karnataka's cultural and performing arts community.

Rishab Shetty's Kantara Chennai event cancelled after stampede at Vijay's rally Rishab Shetty's 'Kantara Chapter 1' promotional event was cancelled in Chennai after a stampede at Vijay's rally left 41 dead. The production house shared a statement and condemned the tragic incident.

Saiyaara actor Ahaan Panday to feature in Ali Abbas Zafar's next with YRF: Report 'Saiyaara' actor Ahaan Panday has signed his second film with director Ali Abbas Zafar and producer Aditya Chopra according to a report. The untitled project is expected to begin filming in early 2026.

Rajeev Sen, ex-wife Charu go pandal hopping with daughter in Kolkata. See pics Rajeev Sen and Charu Asopa celebrated Navratri together in Kolkata with their daughter Ziana. Charu shared photos of them exploring various pandas as a family. Their reunion comes after their divorce in 2023.

Shin-chan's Spicy Kasukabe Dancers proves Bo-chan is no sidekick In this week's Animania we discuss how Bo-chan takes centre stage in 'Shin-chan: Super Hot! Spicy Kasukabe Dancers', proving the quietest characters can leave the loudest impact.

After seven years, Cardi B lands 2nd Billboard No 1 with Am I the Drama? Singer Cardi B's new album 'Am I the Drama?' debuts at No 1 on the Billboard 200. This marks her second chart-topping release and the biggest week for an R&B/hip-hop album by a woman in 2025.

The Raja Saab trailer: Prabhas fights ghosts and ghouls in haunted mansion The trailer of the horror-comedy 'The Raja Saab' released on September 29, 2025. The film features actors Prabhas, Sanjay Dutt, Malavika Mohanan and Nidhhi Agerwal in pivotal roles.

Karan Johar produces India's first fashion reality show India is set to launch its first fashion reality show aimed at showcasing homegrown designers on a global platform with support from Bollywood stars and major investors. The series highlights the journey of emerging talents from smaller towns.

Thamma's Tum Mere Na Huye stars Ayushmann, Rashmika in glam avatar The first song from 'Thamma' titled 'Tum Mere Na Huye, Na Sahi' is finally out. Featuring Rashmika Mandanna and Ayushmann Khurrana, the song blends heartbreak with eye-catching dance moves. Have a look.
My Sam: Riddhima Kapoor Sahni shares adorable mother-daughter moment with Samara Riddhima Kapoor Sahni shared a heartfelt mother-daughter moment with her daughter Samara on Instagram.

Before Kantara Chapter 1, here's a recap and guide to world of Rishab Shetty's film 'Kantara: Chapter 1', written, directed and starring Rishab Shetty, is slated for a grand release on October 2. Ahead of the film's release, here is a recap of 'Kantara', which took Kannada cinema to global stardom.

Priyanka gives shout-out to Diljit, Chamkila team for International Emmy nomination Priyank Chopra wrote a special message for Diljit Dosanjh and the 'Amar Singh Chamkila' team after Emmy nominations. The film has bagged nominations in two categories, including Best Performance by an Actor and Best TV Movie.

Siddhant Chaturvedi grooves to Khaike Paan with college students in Varanasi. Watch Actor Siddhant Chaturvedi attended a college event in Varanasi, dancing with students. Videos of the actor enjoying himself with the students have gone viral.

An OG love letter: When Pawan Kalyan delivered, fans said thank you The release of 'They Call Him OG' marks the triumphant return of Pawan Kalyan, rekindling the passion of his devoted fans across India with a powerful blend of style and emotion. This gangster epic is not just a film but a heartfelt celebration of a two-decade-long bond between the star and his unwavering audience.

BTS' V and IVE's Jang Wonyoung dating? Internet discovers alleged proof Online speculation grew over a possible relationship between BTS' V and IVE's Jang Wonyoung. Social media users shared a 'proof list' connecting the two K-pop idols.

general news.headline: US stopped us: Chidambaram's big 26/11 admission, BJP says too little, too lateAt the time of the attacks in 2008, the Congress veteran leader was the Union Home Minister. He revealed that the then US Secretary of State Condoleeza Rice had visited India to meet him and the Prime Minister, asking them not to react to the situation.

Netanyahu agrees to Trump's plan to end Gaza war, Hamas support in questionThe White House released Trump's 20-point plan. The proposal does not require Palestinians to leave Gaza and calls for an immediate ceasefire once both sides sign on.

Gandhi statue defaced in London, India strongly condemns shameful actThe plinth of the iconic statue, which depicts the Father of the Nation in a seated meditative pose, was discovered daubed with some disturbing graffiti.

He's going to have problems: Trump's fund-freeze threat against Zohran MamdaniDonald Trump lashed out at New York mayoral frontrunner Zohran Mamdani, calling him a self-proclaimed Communist and warning he would face funding blockades if elected. Mamdani hit back, saying Trump was going through the stages of grief.

Nicole Kidman and Keith Urban separate after nearly 20 years of marriageNicole Kidman and Keith Urban have separated following almost two decades together. The couple share two children and have been married since 2006.

Accused of rape by girlfriend, techie dies by suicide; betrayed in love, says noteAccording to the police, the 29-year-old victim met the woman through a matrimonial website while working in Noida. The relationship grew closer over time, but a rape allegation was later filed against him by the woman.

Israel will finish the job itself if...: Netanyahu warns Hamas to accept peace dealNetanyahu backed Trump's 20-point Gaza plan on Monday, calling it a critical step to end the war. The proposal calls for an international Board of Peace, phased Israeli withdrawal and hostage releases.

Vijay's party functionary arrested after Karur rally stampede claimed 41 livesTVK functionary Mathiazhagan was arrested on Monday in the Karur rally stampede case that claimed 41 lives and injured 60 others.

Israeli withdrawal, release of hostages: Trump's 20-point Gaza peace planThe White House unveiled a 20-point Gaza peace plan, proposing an immediate ceasefire, hostage and prisoner exchanges, demilitarisation, humanitarian aid, international governance led by Trump and Tony Blair, and a long-term framework for Gaza's reconstruction.

YouTube to pay $24.5 million to settle Trump lawsuit over January 6 account banYouTube will pay $24.5 million to settle Donald Trump's lawsuit over his post-January 6 suspension. Most funds will go to the National Mall Trust, with no admission of liability.

Video: 4 UP cops dance, chug beer at criminal's birthday bash in bar; suspendedThe incident took place at Rose Bar in Sahibabad, and the suspension was ordered by DCP Trans-Hindon Nimish Patil. A departmental probe and CCTV examination are underway.

From White House, Netanyahu calls Qatari PM to apologise for Doha attackDays after an airstrike on Doha, Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu apologised to his Qatari counterpart over the telephone. The call was made from the White House after Netanyahu met US President Trump.

After 12 years, India set for Women's World Cup return in cricket's grand festivalThe 2025 ICC Women's World Cup is set to take place from September 30 to November 2, with matches being hosted across India and Colombo. Australia, the defending champions, have claimed the title seven times, while India will be aiming to secure their first-ever ICC Women's World Cup triumph.

29-year-old trainee doctor jumps to death from 21st floor in NoidaFamily members told police that Shiva developed a mental health condition during the pandemic, leading him to discontinue his medical training and had been in depression since.

IND vs SL: Harmanpreet Kaur's India eyes winning start to home Women's World CupIndia vs Sri Lanka, Women's World Cup: With home support and strong form on their side, the Indian women's cricket team will look to begin their ODI World Cup campaign on a winning note when they face Sri Lanka in the opener in Guwahati on Tuesday.

Ozempic approved in India, Novo Nordisk country head says 'much-needed'As India grapples with a surge in lifestyle-related illnesses, the approval of Ozempic marks more than just a new diabetes drug; it signals a shift toward modernising chronic disease care. Calling it a "much needed move," Novo Nordisk India's managing director welcomed the decision as a timely intervention.

Pakistan players were saying lot of things, I wanted my bat to respond: Tilak VarmaPakistan players had "a lot to say" to Tilak Varma as he walked out to bat in the Asia Cup final, spurring the young Indian batter to play one of the most defining innings of his career so far in the Asia Cup final.

Canada lists Bishnoi gang as terrorist entity, says it's creating climate of fearAnnouncing the decision, Minister of Public Safety Gary Anandasangaree said that acts of violence and terror have no place in Canada, especially those that target specific communities to create a climate of fear and intimidation.
Trump slaps 100% tariff on non-US made films, says other countries stole businessTrump said he will be imposing a 100% tariff on any and all movies that are made outside the United States.

Why Rajasthan risks contempt after losing India's longest probate caseThe Supreme Court's Khetri Estate ruling redefines property rights in the country, reshaping state power over wills and private disputes.

World Para Athletics Championships: Javelin star Rinku Hooda bags India's 2nd goldRinku Hooda and Sundar Singh Gurjar produced a historic one-two finish in the men's javelin throw F46 at the World Para Athletics Championships.

HAL awaits fourth GE-404 engine for Tejas Mk1A, first flight expected in OctoberHAL's Nashik facility is ready for the first flight of the Tejas Mk1A in October. Sources said that the first two aircraft are on track for delivery to the Indian Air Force (IAF) next month, with one already ready for handover.

Who disrupted BJP's 10-year winning streak in Assam?Assam, where the BJP has of late enjoyed an uninterrupted electoral run since 2016, has faced the first defeat as Hagrama Mohilary's Bodo People's Front (BPF) swept the 2025 Bodoland Territorial Council (BTC) elections. The sweep by Mohilary's BPF has disrupted the BJP's dominance, just ahead of the Assam Assembly election.

Bengaluru tenant recovers Rs 2.6 lakh deposit after dispute with landlord, shares howIn the post shared on r/Bangalorerentals, the tenant said that he had rented a 3.5 BHK apartment for Rs 55,000 a month during the Covid-19 period, but later found himself in conflict with the flat owner, a retired Army officer.

sports.headline: IND vs SL: Harmanpreet Kaur's India eyes winning start to home Women's World Cup India vs Sri Lanka, Women's World Cup: With home support and strong form on their side, the Indian women's cricket team will look to begin their ODI World Cup campaign on a winning note when they face Sri Lanka in the opener in Guwahati on Tuesday.

After 12 years, India set for Women's World Cup return in cricket's grand festival The 2025 ICC Women's World Cup is set to take place from September 30 to November 2, with matches being hosted across India and Colombo. Australia, the defending champions, have claimed the title seven times, while India will be aiming to secure their first-ever ICC Women's World Cup triumph.

Asia Cup: Suryakumar Yadav, Hardik receive warm welcome in Mumbai after title win Team India's finest, skipper Suryakumar Yadav and star all-rounder Hardik Pandya received a rousing response as they returned to the Mumbai airport following their triumph at the Asia Cup, downing Pakistan to win the title.

2nd T20I: Nepal secure historic series win vs West Indies with 90-run victory Nepal achieved a historic milestone on Monday (September 29), securing their first-ever T20I series win over a full-member nation by dominating former world champions West Indies in the second match in Sharjah.

Watch: Tilak Varma receives rousing welcome in Hyderabad after Asia Cup heroics India's Asia Cup 2025 final hero, Tilak Varma, received a rapturous welcome from fans as he returned to Hyderabad on Monday. The 21-year-old southpaw, who scored an unbeaten 69 to seal victory against Pakistan, was greeted with thunderous cheers at Shamshabad Airport.

Women's World Cup in India watershed moment for the game: Sachin Tendulkar Sachin Tendulkar believes the ICC Women's World Cup in India marks a pivotal moment for women's cricket, calling on the nation to embrace it as a catalyst for fresh aspirations and equal recognition.

Gutted to miss final but Indian team showed character: Hardik on Asia Cup win Hardik Pandya was understandably "gutted" to have missed the Asia Cup final against Pakistan due to a niggle, but he found comfort in the team's title triumph, saying such tight chases will stand the side in good stead for the future.

India are under no pressure: Harmanpreet confident of winning Women's World Cup India women's cricket captain Harmanpreet Kaur expresses strong confidence ahead of their first ODI World Cup match at home. The team aims to leverage recent successes and fan support to make history in the tournament.

World Para Athletics Championships: Javelin star Rinku Hooda bags India's 2nd gold Rinku Hooda and Sundar Singh Gurjar produced a historic one-two finish in the men's javelin throw F46 at the World Para Athletics Championships.

Pakistan players were saying lot of things, I wanted my bat to respond: Tilak Varma Pakistan players had "a lot to say" to Tilak Varma as he walked out to bat in the Asia Cup final, spurring the young Indian batter to play one of the most defining innings of his career so far in the Asia Cup final.

Watch: Mohammad Amir nearly brought to tears after Pakistan's Asia Cup final loss Mohammad Amir was nearly brought to tears after Pakistan lost the Asia Cup final to India. His reflections highlight Pakistan's batting failures and praise India's Tilak Varma's composure.

Gutted to miss final but Indian team showed character: Hardik on Asia Cup win Hardik Pandya was understandably "gutted" to have missed the Asia Cup final against Pakistan due to a niggle, but he found comfort in the team's title triumph, saying such tight chases will stand the side in good stead for the future.

India are under no pressure: Harmanpreet confident of winning Women's World Cup India women's cricket captain Harmanpreet Kaur expresses strong confidence ahead of their first ODI World Cup match at home. The team aims to leverage recent successes and fan support to make history in the tournament.

World Para Athletics Championships: Javelin star Rinku Hooda bags India's 2nd gold Rinku Hooda and Sundar Singh Gurjar produced a historic one-two finish in the men's javelin throw F46 at the World Para Athletics Championships.

Pakistan players were saying lot of things, I wanted my bat to respond: Tilak Varma Pakistan players had "a lot to say" to Tilak Varma as he walked out to bat in the Asia Cup final, spurring the young Indian batter to play one of the most defining innings of his career so far in the Asia Cup final.

Watch: Mohammad Amir nearly brought to tears after Pakistan's Asia Cup final loss Mohammad Amir was nearly brought to tears after Pakistan lost the Asia Cup final to India. His reflections highlight Pakistan's batting failures and praise India's Tilak Varma's composure.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
